channel.title: SlangPress - Latest News & Articles
channel.description: Stay updated with the latest news, technology updates, and trending stories from around the world. Fresh content updated regularly.

item.title: What chance does Nigeria's new opposition coalition have?
item.description: Nigeria's opposition parties, facing setbacks and defections to the ruling APC, have united to form the All Democratic Alliance (ADA). This new coalition aims to challenge President Bola Tinubu in the 2027 elections. The ADA's success hinges on its ability to overcome internal divisions, present a unified platform, and effectively mobilize voters against the incumbent. Political analysts are closely watching to see if this alliance can provide a credible alternative and alter Nigeria's political landscape.

item.title: Jose Mourinho's Fenerbahce eyeing summer transfer for PSG outcast
item.description: Jose Mourinho's Fenerbahce is reportedly considering a summer transfer for a Paris Saint-Germain (PSG) player deemed surplus to requirements. The Turkish club, aiming to strengthen its squad under the renowned manager, seeks to challenge reigning champions Galatasaray for dominance in the Turkish League. While specific player details remain undisclosed, the move signals Fenerbahce's ambition to compete at the highest level and potentially disrupt Galatasaray's recent success. The transfer window will be closely watched to see if Mourinho can secure his target and impact the Turkish League landscape.

item.title: Lena Dunham Says She Took an ‘Intentional Break’ From Acting After ‘Girls’
item.description: Lena Dunham, known for creating and starring in the HBO series 'Girls,' has revealed she consciously stepped away from acting following the show's conclusion. In a recent interview, Dunham discussed her decision to take an 'intentional break,' implying a need to recharge and pursue other creative endeavors. She also spoke about her friendship with pop superstar Taylor Swift, describing Swift as an 'mind-blowing person,' highlighting the singer's intelligence and impact.

item.title: Germany updates: Schools call for heat wave measures
item.description: Germany is experiencing a significant heat wave, prompting calls for increased protective measures for vulnerable populations. Schools are urging authorities to implement strategies to safeguard students from the extreme temperatures. These measures could include adjusted schedules, cooling systems, and hydration initiatives. Hospitals are also advocating for similar protective protocols to ensure the well-being of patients and staff. The demands highlight the growing concern over the impact of climate change and the need for proactive adaptation strategies to mitigate the health risks associated with extreme weather events.

item.title: Elon Musk slams Trump’s ‘Big Beautiful Bill’, calls for new political party
item.description: Elon Musk has publicly criticized Donald Trump's economic policies, specifically targeting Trump's tax cuts and spending bill, which Musk derisively referred to as the 'Big Beautiful Bill.' This latest salvo in a growing feud between the two high-profile figures has led Musk to suggest the need for a new political party in the United States. The exchange highlights a widening ideological gap between the tech entrepreneur and the former president, sparking debate about the future of American politics and the role of influential figures in shaping policy discussions.

item.title: Court suspends Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra
item.description: Thailand's Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra has been suspended by the court amid rising discontent over her response to a recent border clash with Cambodia. The incident, which occurred on May 28, involved an armed confrontation resulting in the death of a Cambodian soldier. The suspension comes as Shinawatra faces increasing pressure to address the escalating tensions and provide a clear strategy for resolving the border dispute. The court's decision adds further instability to the political landscape in Thailand.

item.title: Some banks say Trump's 'big, beautiful bill' will be a boon for the U.S. economy
item.description: The American Bankers Association (ABA) has voiced strong support for provisions within a proposed bill, referring to it as a potential boon for the U.S. economy. In a letter released Sunday, the ABA specifically highlighted the "much needed tax relief" offered by the legislation. While the ABA didn't explicitly name the bill, the context strongly suggests they are referring to proposals championed by former President Trump. The association believes the tax cuts will stimulate economic growth and benefit the banking sector. Further details of the bill and its potential impact remain to be seen as it progresses through the legislative process.

item.title: One UI 8’s Now Brief will make sure you don’t miss a birthday again
item.description: Samsung's upcoming One UI 8 will feature a new 'Now Brief' function designed to help users remember important events like birthdays. Now Brief will proactively notify users of upcoming birthdays and even suggest using AI to create personalized birthday cards. This feature aims to streamline the process of remembering and celebrating special occasions, potentially increasing user engagement with Samsung's ecosystem through its AI capabilities and convenient reminders.

item.title: Iran ‘needs more time’ to decide on resuming nuclear talks with US
item.description: Iran's foreign minister stated that the country 'needs more time' to decide on resuming nuclear talks with the United States. This announcement coincides with a call from the G7 nations for renewed negotiations aimed at addressing Iran's nuclear program. The G7's appeal underscores international concern and pressure for a diplomatic solution to ensure Iran's nuclear activities remain peaceful and transparent. The delay raises questions about the future of the Joint Comprehensive Plan of Action (JCPOA) and the prospects for de-escalating tensions in the region.

item.title: Dana Carvey Says His Biden Impression Was ‘Delicate’: ‘He Was Compromised Mentally’
item.description: Dana Carvey, known for his comedic roles including his time on Saturday Night Live, recently commented on his portrayal of President Joe Biden. Carvey described his impression as 'delicate,' suggesting that he felt Biden was 'compromised mentally.' While Carvey is known for his political impressions, this statement offers a glimpse into his perspective on the current president. The comedian has not elaborated further on the specific reasons behind his assessment.

item.title: The best ereaders for 2025
item.description: Ereaders offer a portable alternative to physical books, packing entire libraries into pocket-sized devices. Their E Ink screens provide a paper-like reading experience that's gentler on the eyes compared to phones or tablets. Modern ereaders boast crisp text displays and features like speakers, color screens, and stylus support. Extensive testing of models from leading brands like Kobo, Kindle, and Boox has been conducted to identify the top ereaders for various needs. Key considerations include screen quality, features, and book acquisition methods.

item.title: Al-Hilal 'climb Everest' - but 'worrying signs' for Man City
item.description: Al-Hilal's victory over Manchester City in the Club World Cup has been hailed as a monumental achievement, with their manager comparing it to 'climbing Mount Everest without oxygen'. The Saudi Arabian team's win signifies a major milestone in the country's ambitious project to establish itself as a prominent force in global football, fueled by significant investment. However, the defeat also raises 'worrying signs' for Manchester City, prompting concerns about their current form and performance on the international stage.

item.title: An interview with Claude AI product lead Scott White on Claude Code writing 90% of its own code, MCP, coding being accessible to non-technical workers, and more (Michael Nuñez/VentureBeat)
item.description: VentureBeat interviewed Scott White, the product lead for Claude AI, discussing the AI's impressive coding capabilities. White highlighted that Claude Code can autonomously generate 90% of its own code. The interview also touched upon the concept of Machine-Computer Partnership (MCP) and the increasing accessibility of coding to individuals without traditional technical backgrounds. White emphasized the rapid evolution of AI from a mere novelty to a valuable collaborative tool in the workplace, suggesting a significant shift in how coding and software development are approached.

item.title: This fund returned 21% in May alone buying ‘left-for-dead’ stocks — and it has a new target
item.description: Whetstone Capital's fund achieved a 21% return in May by investing in undervalued stocks considered 'left-for-dead.' The fund's strategy involves a three-year average holding period, allowing investments made during the 2022 market downturn to mature and generate profits this spring. This approach focuses on identifying companies with long-term potential that are currently overlooked by the market. Whetstone Capital is now targeting new opportunities, suggesting a continued focus on distressed or underperforming assets with potential for future growth.

item.title: NBA free agency grades: Hawks, Rockets make early splashes; Grizzlies' Jackson lands $240M extension
item.description: NBA free agency is underway, and Kevin Pelton has assessed the early moves, highlighting the Atlanta Hawks and Houston Rockets as teams making significant improvements. The Hawks' acquisitions are expected to bolster their roster, while the Rockets are strategically building for the future. Ja Morant's Memphis Grizzlies also secured a major win by signing Jaren Jackson Jr. to a $240 million contract extension, solidifying their core for years to come. Pelton's analysis provides insights into the potential impact of these signings and extensions on the upcoming NBA season.

item.title: Germany updates: Schools call for measures against heatwaves
item.description: As Germany experiences a significant heatwave, schools and hospitals are urging authorities to implement protective measures for students and patients. Educators are particularly concerned about the impact of high temperatures on learning environments and student well-being. DW reports that the calls for action are intensifying as the heatwave persists, raising concerns about health and safety across the country.

item.title: US accuses Harvard of anti-Semitic harassment of Jewish students, staff
item.description: The U.S. government is accusing Harvard University of fostering an environment of anti-Semitic harassment against Jewish students and staff. A task force is investigating allegations that Harvard has violated the rights of Jewish individuals, and is threatening to withhold all federal funding if the university fails to address the issue. The accusations center on claims of discrimination and a hostile environment created by the university's handling of anti-Semitic incidents. The potential loss of federal funding could have significant financial repercussions for Harvard.

item.title: Manchester City knocked out of Club World Cup as Al-Hilal strike twice in extra time
item.description: Al-Hilal defeated Manchester City 4-3 after extra time in a stunning Club World Cup last-16 upset. The match, characterized by fluctuating momentum, saw City gradually lose their grip as the game progressed. Marcos Leonardo scored the decisive goal in the 112th minute, capitalizing on a rebound after Ederson saved a header from Sergej Milinković-Savić. Leonardo's goal sparked jubilant celebrations for Al-Hilal and ended City's hopes, despite Phil Foden's late equalizer earlier in extra time. Al-Hilal now advances to the quarter-finals to face Fluminense.

item.title: Red Sox's Wilyer Abreu makes MLB history with inside-the-park home run, grand slam in same game vs. Reds
item.description: Boston Red Sox outfielder Wilyer Abreu etched his name in MLB history during a game against the Cincinnati Reds. Abreu became only the sixth player ever to hit both an inside-the-park home run and a grand slam in the same game. This rare feat highlights Abreu's impressive performance and contributes to the Red Sox's season narrative. Further details about the game's outcome and Abreu's overall stats are expected to follow.

item.title: Oura Ring 5 wishlist: All the features I want to see
item.description: The Oura Ring, a popular wearable health tracker, is anticipated to release its fifth generation. Speculation is growing regarding potential new features and improvements. Fitness enthusiasts and tech reviewers are compiling wishlists, suggesting advancements in areas such as enhanced sleep tracking, more accurate activity recognition, improved battery life, and integration with other health platforms. The success of the Oura Ring 5 will likely depend on its ability to deliver meaningful upgrades that address user feedback and stay ahead of the competition in the crowded wearable market.

item.title: Amazon says it has deployed over 1M robots in its warehouses, its most ever and close to its human workforce, with 75% of global deliveries aided by robotics (Sebastian Herrera/Wall Street Journal)
item.description: Amazon has announced it has deployed over one million robots in its warehouses globally, marking its largest robotic workforce to date. This figure positions its robot population near its human employee count. According to the company, robots now assist in 75% of global deliveries. The Wall Street Journal reports that this increased automation underscores Amazon's ongoing efforts to streamline operations and improve efficiency in its fulfillment network. Photographs and videos documenting the robotic deployment were captured by Desiree Rios for the WSJ.

item.title: Goldman’s stock surges to another record, as the ‘big winner’ of Fed’s stress tests
item.description: Goldman Sachs' stock has reached a new record high, solidifying its position as a top performer in the banking sector. This surge follows the Federal Reserve's stress tests, where Goldman Sachs demonstrated strong financial resilience. The bank's stock is up 23% in the first half of 2025, outpacing the broader market. JPMorgan Chase has also seen significant gains, rising 22% during the same period. The robust performance of these financial institutions indicates a positive outlook for the banking industry.

item.title: Trump ends Syria sanctions, orders terror designation review
item.description: President Donald Trump has officially ended US sanctions against Syria. This decision, according to the Syrian government in Damascus, is anticipated to remove barriers hindering the country's economic recovery. The move signals a potential shift in US policy towards Syria, although the full implications remain to be seen. The US government has not yet released a detailed statement explaining the rationale behind lifting the sanctions.

item.title: California Democrats Agree to Roll Back Landmark Environmental Law
item.description: California Democrats have reached an agreement to roll back aspects of the California Environmental Quality Act (CEQA), a landmark environmental law. The changes, demanded by Gov. Gavin Newsom, are aimed at streamlining housing development and addressing the state's ongoing housing crisis. This represents a significant philosophical shift for Democratic leaders in the state, who have historically championed CEQA as a vital tool for environmental protection. The specific details of the rollback and its potential impact on future development projects are expected to be released shortly.

item.title: ‘Almost everybody’ in the U.S. has a pair of clogs. BofA analysts say there’s still a lot to like about Crocs.
item.description: Bank of America (BofA) analysts remain optimistic about Crocs' growth potential, despite the widespread popularity of the brand's signature clogs in the United States. The analysts believe that key growth drivers for Crocs will be Western Europe, China, and India. This suggests that while the U.S. market may be approaching saturation, significant opportunities remain in international markets. BofA's positive outlook indicates confidence in Crocs' ability to continue expanding its global reach and maintain its growth trajectory.

item.title: Senator Blackburn Pulls Support for AI Moratorium in Trump’s ‘Big Beautiful Bill’ Amid Backlash
item.description: Senator Marsha Blackburn has withdrawn her support for a proposed AI moratorium within what some call Donald Trump's 'Big Beautiful Bill.' This decision follows criticism that the bill would effectively shield Big Tech companies from accountability, particularly concerning the regulation of social media platforms. Opponents argued the bill would act as a 'get-out-of-jail-free card' for these corporations, severely limiting the government's ability to enforce regulations and address potential harms caused by AI and social media practices. Blackburn's move throws the future of AI regulation within the bill into uncertainty.

item.title: Chris Brown’s Lawsuit Over Alleged Nightclub Attack Dismissed by Accuser
item.description: A civil lawsuit against Chris Brown regarding an alleged nightclub attack in London has been dismissed by the accuser. While this removes one legal hurdle for the artist, he still faces criminal charges in connection with the same incident. The details surrounding the alleged attack remain unclear, but the ongoing criminal case suggests further legal proceedings are expected. This dismissal offers a partial victory for Brown, but the unresolved criminal charges continue to present a significant legal challenge.

item.title: Jenny Hval Cancels 2025 North American Tour Dates
item.description: Norwegian musician Jenny Hval has announced the cancellation of her scheduled North American tour dates for September 2025. The tour was expected to bring her performances to several major cities throughout the United States and Canada. No official reason has been given for the cancellation. item.title: Investigation: three US Treasury hacks in the past five years were due to a failure to deploy basic security measures, as DOGE cuts further weaken the agency (Bloomberg)
item.description: A Bloomberg investigation reveals that the U.S. Treasury Department suffered three major cybersecurity breaches in the past five years due to a failure to implement basic security measures. The report highlights that readily available cybersecurity protocols, if deployed, could have prevented the attacks or significantly reduced the intrusion time. The investigation also suggests that budget cuts, specifically those impacting the Department's cybersecurity capabilities, have further weakened the agency's defenses, leaving it vulnerable to future attacks.

item.title: Steam can now show you how much frame generation changes your games
item.description: Valve has updated the Steam Client with a new performance monitor, allowing users to see a breakdown of frame rates and understand how frame generation technologies like Nvidia DLSS and AMD FSR impact their games. The monitor displays overall FPS and can be configured to show detailed information on CPU, GPU, and RAM utilization. The initial release is focused on Windows users and common GPU hardware, offering varying levels of detail from a simple FPS counter to comprehensive hardware usage data. This update aims to provide gamers with better insights into their game's performance and the effectiveness of frame generation techniques.

item.title: Polycystic ovary syndrome may be passed on via chemical tags on DNA
item.description: Research suggests that polycystic ovary syndrome (PCOS) may be passed down through epigenetic tags on DNA. A new study found altered patterns of these chemical tags in the eggs and embryos of individuals with PCOS. Epigenetic tags influence gene expression without changing the underlying DNA sequence, potentially explaining how PCOS is inherited across generations. This discovery could lead to a better understanding of PCOS inheritance and potentially new diagnostic or therapeutic approaches.

item.title: Household energy bills fall but may not go much lower
item.description: Typical household energy bills are set to decrease by £11 per month. This reduction, while providing some relief to consumers, is not expected to significantly lower energy costs in the long term. Factors such as global energy market volatility and infrastructure investments continue to influence pricing. Experts advise consumers to remain vigilant about energy consumption and explore efficiency measures to mitigate future cost increases.

item.title: If you're using Microsoft Authenticator to store your passwords, don't
item.description: Microsoft Authenticator is phasing out its password management features. The service has already stopped allowing users to add or import new passwords this month. Autofill functionality will be disabled in July 2025, and all stored passwords will be inaccessible by August 2025. Payment information will be deleted in July, followed by unsaved generated passwords in August. Microsoft suggests using the Edge browser for password management within its ecosystem, but Authenticator users may need to consider alternative password managers. Passkey support within Authenticator will remain unaffected.

item.title: Trump formally orders lifting of Syria sanctions
item.description: President Trump has formally ordered the lifting of sanctions on 518 Syrian individuals and entities, according to the US Treasury. The Treasury Department confirmed the removals from its sanctions list following the president's decree. The move signifies a potential shift in US policy towards Syria, though the full implications remain to be seen. It's unclear what prompted the decision, but analysts suggest it could be aimed at facilitating reconstruction efforts or encouraging certain actors to engage in negotiations. The impact of this decision on the ground in Syria and on regional geopolitics will be closely monitored.

item.title: Musk shreds Trump's tax bill as 'DEBT SLAVERY,' vows to unseat Republicans who back it
item.description: Elon Musk has strongly criticized the Trump-era tax bill, labeling it 'DEBT SLAVERY.' As the Senate debates amendments to the bill, Musk vowed to actively campaign against Republican lawmakers who support its continuation. His remarks highlight the ongoing controversy surrounding the tax legislation and its potential economic impact. Musk's opposition adds another layer of complexity to the already contentious debate, signaling a potential clash with key Republican figures.

item.title: A mammoth tusk boomerang from Poland is 40,000 years old
item.description: Archaeologists in Poland have unearthed a 40,000-year-old boomerang crafted from a mammoth tusk. This unique artifact, discovered in an unexpected location, provides significant insight into the tool-making capabilities and cultural practices of early humans during the Paleolithic period. The find challenges existing assumptions about the geographical distribution of boomerang technology and underscores the potential for further discoveries to reshape our understanding of ancient societies. Researchers are analyzing the boomerang to determine its precise function and the methods used in its creation, hoping to unlock more secrets about the lives of its creators.

item.title: Why a GOP senator says the budget bill breaks Trump's promise
item.description: A contentious budget bill in the Senate is facing criticism from within the Republican party. Senator Thom Tillis of North Carolina argues that the bill violates President Trump's promise not to cut Medicaid. The Congressional Budget Office estimates that the Senate version of the bill could lead to nearly 12 million people losing health insurance due to significant reductions in Medicaid spending. While Trump claims the cuts target waste and abuse, Tillis questions how to justify the potential loss of coverage for hundreds of thousands of his constituents. The debate highlights a growing divide within the GOP regarding healthcare and budget priorities, as reported by KFF Health.

item.title: Astronomers discover a galaxy frozen in time for billions of years: 'Fossil galaxies are like the dinosaurs of the universe'
item.description: Astronomers have identified a unique galaxy that appears to have remained largely unchanged for billions of years. Described as a 'fossil galaxy,' this celestial object offers a rare glimpse into the early universe and the processes that shaped galactic evolution. Unlike most galaxies that have undergone significant transformations through mergers and star formation, this galaxy has seemingly been 'frozen in time,' preserving its primordial characteristics. Researchers believe studying this ancient galaxy will provide valuable insights into the conditions and mechanisms that governed galaxy formation in the early cosmos.

item.title: Middle East updates: Israeli strikes on Gaza kill scores
item.description: Israeli forces conducted strikes in Gaza, resulting in numerous Palestinian deaths. A popular cafe was targeted, and reports indicate that Israeli forces also opened fire on Palestinians gathered near an aid distribution center. The incidents have further escalated tensions in the region. International organizations are calling for investigations into the events and urging restraint from all parties involved to prevent further loss of life. Details are still emerging, and DW is providing ongoing coverage of the situation.

item.title: Meta shares hit all-time high as Mark Zuckerberg goes on AI hiring blitz
item.description: Meta's stock price reached an all-time high on Monday, fueled by increasing investor confidence in the company's strategic shift towards artificial intelligence. This surge is directly linked to Mark Zuckerberg's recent announcement of a new AI superintelligence group within Meta, signaling a significant investment and focus on advancing AI technologies. The market's positive reaction reflects a belief that Meta's foray into AI could yield substantial future growth and innovation, despite previous concerns about the company's metaverse investments.

item.title: After Glastonbury, Bob Vylan faces U.K. criminal investigation and U.S. visa revocation
item.description: British punk-rap duo Bob Vylan is facing a U.K. criminal investigation and potential U.S. visa revocation following chants against the Israeli military during their Glastonbury performance, which was broadcast live by the BBC on Saturday. The controversial act has sparked debate and drawn criticism. Irish-language rap group Kneecap is also reportedly under investigation in connection to similar actions or statements made during the festival. The investigations highlight the sensitivity surrounding political statements made by artists on prominent platforms and the potential consequences for their careers and travel.

item.title: Gold and platinum are proven stock market predictors. Here’s what they’re saying now.
item.description: A significant drop in the gold-platinum ratio is signaling a potential downturn in the stock market, according to analysts who track this market-timing indicator. The ratio, which compares the price of gold to the price of platinum, has historically been a predictor of stock market performance. A falling ratio often precedes a decline in stock prices, suggesting investors should exercise caution. While not foolproof, the gold-platinum ratio serves as one tool among many for assessing market risk.

item.title: The latest version of the Senate's OBBB has a provision removing the 6 GHz band's protection from spectrum auctions; Wi-Fi 6E and Wi-FI 7 utilize the 6 GHz band (Jon Brodkin/Ars Technica)
item.description: A new version of the Senate's OBBB (likely referring to an infrastructure or broadband bill) includes a provision to remove protections on the 6 GHz band, potentially opening it up for spectrum auctions. This could impact Wi-Fi 6E and Wi-Fi 7, which rely on this band for operation. Senator Ted Cruz is reportedly behind the plan, aiming to reallocate these frequencies for exclusive use by wireless carriers. This move has the potential to disrupt current Wi-Fi technology and future advancements, potentially impacting consumers and businesses that rely on Wi-Fi connectivity.

item.title: Sinners will hit Max with a version translated into Black American Sign Language
item.description: Warner Bros. Discovery is enhancing accessibility for the streaming debut of 'Sinners' on Max. Starting July 4th, the vampire film will be available with a Black American Sign Language (BASL) interpretation. 'Sinners' follows twin brothers, portrayed by Michael B. Jordan, and their cousin, played by Miles Caton, as they establish a nightclub in Mississippi. The film blends genre elements with social commentary, exploring racial themes alongside supernatural conflicts arising from the nightclub's popularity with both humans and vampires. This BASL version aims to broaden the film's reach and inclusivity.

item.title: Identities of More Than 80 Americans Stolen for North Korean IT Worker Scams
item.description: The US Justice Department has announced that the identities of over 80 Americans have been stolen and used in scams perpetrated by North Korean IT workers. The announcement coincided with one arrest and a crackdown on alleged "laptop farms" throughout the United States. These farms are believed to be used to facilitate the impersonation of American citizens by North Korean tech workers, allowing them to secure remote work and funnel funds back to North Korea in violation of sanctions. The investigation is ongoing, and further arrests are expected.

item.title: Food delivery apps to tighten checks to stop illegal workers
item.description: The UK government has engaged with major food delivery platforms like Deliveroo, Uber Eats, and Just Eat to implement stricter verification processes for their drivers. This initiative follows reports indicating a rise in account sub-letting, potentially enabling undocumented workers to operate within the system. The goal is to enhance accountability and ensure compliance with labor laws, addressing concerns about the legality and safety of the delivery workforce. More robust checks are expected to be rolled out in the coming weeks.

item.title: Greek government in crisis after EU subsidy scandal
item.description: The Greek government is facing a significant crisis following allegations of widespread misuse of EU agricultural subsidies. The scandal centers around claims that funds intended for agricultural development were illegally obtained, potentially involving fictitious banana farms on Mount Olympus. Several government officials have already resigned in the wake of the accusations, threatening the stability of the ruling coalition and prompting calls for a thorough investigation into the matter. The EU is also reportedly launching its own inquiry to determine the extent of the fraud and ensure proper accountability.

item.title: Steelers' latest all-in trade for Dolphins' Jalen Ramsey could end GM Omar Khan's career
item.description: The Pittsburgh Steelers have reportedly traded Minkah Fitzpatrick to the Miami Dolphins for Jalen Ramsey, a move that has sent shockwaves through the NFL. While Ramsey is a top-tier cornerback, the Steelers had to part with the beloved Minkah Fitzpatrick to secure the deal. This high-stakes decision places significant pressure on Steelers General Manager Omar Khan, as the trade's success or failure could directly impact his future with the team. The Steelers are betting big on Ramsey's impact, and the consequences could be severe if the gamble doesn't pay off.

item.title: Israel kills 85 Palestinians, bombing across Gaza amid new ceasefire push
item.description: Israeli forces have reportedly killed 85 Palestinians in renewed bombings across Gaza, targeting residential areas, schools, and hospitals. The attacks also struck areas where aid was being distributed, exacerbating the humanitarian crisis. This escalation occurs amidst renewed international efforts to broker a ceasefire. The Israeli military's operations have forced thousands of Palestinians to flee from the northern part of the Gaza Strip, further displacing a population already facing dire conditions and limited access to essential resources. The international community is urging restraint and a return to negotiations to halt the violence.

item.description: July 2025's streaming landscape offers a mixed bag, with several platforms showcasing returning favorites and highly anticipated premieres. Netflix leads with 'Happy Gilmore 2,' a sequel sure to draw in comedy fans. Hulu continues its popular series 'It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia.' Paramount+ will release new episodes of 'Star Trek: Strange New Worlds,' catering to sci-fi enthusiasts. Finally, Max marks the streaming debut of 'Sinners'. While the month may be considered relatively slow in terms of blockbuster releases, these offerings provide a solid lineup for diverse viewing preferences.

item.title: Three months of Audible is only $3 thanks to this Prime Day deal
item.description: Amazon's Prime Day 2025 is just around the corner, and early deals are already surfacing. New Audible subscribers can snag a three-month subscription to Audible Premium Plus for just $3, a significant discount of $42. This offer, valid until July 31st (extending beyond the four-day Prime Week event), grants access to one credit per month, redeemable for any audiobook in the Audible library. Be aware that the subscription auto-renews at $15 per month after the promotional period. This deal presents a substantial saving for audiobook enthusiasts looking to explore Audible's extensive catalog.

item.title: White House expects more countries will drop digital services taxes after Canada backs down
item.description: The White House anticipates a further decline in digital services taxes (DSTs) globally following Canada's recent decision to step back from implementing them. Kevin Hassett's statement arrives shortly before the U.S. government's deadline for potentially reinstating significant tariffs. These tariffs were initially threatened in response to various countries imposing DSTs, which the U.S. views as discriminatory towards American tech companies. The expectation is that other nations may reconsider their DST policies to avoid similar trade disputes with the United States.

item.title: NATO’s VC fund backs biotech startup for first time
item.description: The NATO Innovation Fund (NIF), NATO's venture capital arm, has made its inaugural investment in a biotechnology company. NIF is co-leading a $35 million Series A funding round for Portal Biotech, a UK-based startup developing AI-powered diagnostic devices for rapid pathogen detection. Portal's technology aims to strengthen NATO's defenses against biological warfare by providing portable, on-site identification of biological threats at the single-molecule level. This differs from traditional lab-based diagnostics, offering crucial field deployment capabilities for enhanced defense and security. The investment highlights NATO's commitment to supporting innovative technologies that bolster its security infrastructure.

item.title: Tumblr’s move to WordPress and fediverse integration is ‘on hold’
item.description: Automattic, the company behind WordPress, has put its plan to migrate Tumblr's backend to WordPress on hold. CEO Matt Mullenweg announced the decision, citing a shift in focus towards user-facing features. The migration, initially intended to streamline cross-platform sharing for Tumblr's vast collection of blogs, is now deemed less of a priority. While Mullenweg expressed a continued interest in the move for its potential to simplify the platform, the company is currently prioritizing features directly requested by users. This decision also impacts the planned integration of Tumblr posts into the fediverse.

item.title: Robinhood announces an expanded offering of tokenized US stocks across Europe, crypto staking in US, a Layer 2 blockchain for real-world asset settlement, more (MacKenzie Sigalos/CNBC)
item.description: Robinhood is significantly expanding its services, announcing several new initiatives. The company will now offer tokenized U.S. stocks to European users, allowing them to trade fractions of shares and access the U.S. market more easily. In the United States, Robinhood is introducing crypto staking, enabling users to earn rewards on their digital asset holdings. Furthermore, Robinhood is developing a Layer 2 blockchain solution designed for the settlement of real-world assets, aiming to streamline and reduce the cost of traditional financial transactions. These expansions mark a strategic move by Robinhood to broaden its user base and diversify its offerings in both traditional and digital finance.

item.title: The WNBA is expanding again, adding 3 new cities for a record 18 teams
item.description: The WNBA announced it will expand to 18 teams with the addition of franchises in Cleveland (2028), Detroit (2029), and Philadelphia (2030). This marks a significant period of growth for the league, increasing its presence in major markets and offering more opportunities for athletes. The expansion reflects the WNBA's increasing popularity and commitment to reaching a wider audience across the United States.

item.title: Trump’s tariff threat pushes Canada to scrap digital services tax
item.description: Canada is reportedly considering scrapping its planned digital services tax (DST) due to pressure from the United States, particularly threats of tariffs from former President Donald Trump. The DST, aimed at taxing revenue generated by large tech companies operating in Canada, disproportionately affects US-based firms. Trump's tariff threats, intended to protect American interests, appear to be a significant factor in Canada's potential reversal. This move highlights the ongoing tension between national tax policies and international trade relations, particularly in the digital economy. Scrapping the DST would be a win for US tech giants, allowing them to avoid additional taxation in the Canadian market.

item.title: Roundtables: Inside OpenAI’s Empire with Karen Hao
item.description: In a recent roundtable discussion recorded on June 30, 2025, former MIT Technology Review senior editor Karen Hao discussed her book, *Empire of AI: Dreams and Nightmares in Sam Altman’s OpenAI*. The book chronicles OpenAI's ascent to global influence and its multifaceted consequences. Hao, joined by executive editor Niall Firth, delved into the key themes explored in her book, offering insights into the company's internal dynamics, strategic decisions, and broader societal implications. The conversation provided a comprehensive look at OpenAI's impact on technology, ethics, and the future of artificial intelligence.

item.title: Kate Nash Attacks J.K. Rowling, Rod Stewart, and Matty Healy’s Mom at Glastonbury
item.description: During her Glastonbury performance, Kate Nash criticized J.K. Rowling, Rod Stewart, and Denise Welch (Matty Healy's mother) for their views on various social issues. Nash specifically targeted Rowling, stating, "The loudest feminist voice in the U.K. is currently transphobic." While the context of her remarks about Stewart and Welch wasn't explicitly stated in reports, the overall message conveyed a sense of disappointment and condemnation of figures she perceives as having misused their platforms. The comments sparked debate online, with some supporting Nash's stance and others criticizing her for publicly calling out these individuals.

item.title: Former MMA champion & UFC fighter Ben Askren receives life-saving double lung transplant
item.description: Former MMA champion Ben Askren, known for his stints in UFC, Bellator, and ONE Championship, has received a life-saving double lung transplant. Askren had been hospitalized with severe pneumonia, facing complications including insurance coverage issues. His wife confirmed the successful transplant after a donor was found. Askren is now recovering from the surgery. His career highlights include undefeated championship reigns in Bellator and ONE Championship, though his UFC tenure was shorter. The transplant marks a significant step in his battle for health after a serious illness.

item.title: The Project Hail Mary trailer looks like The Martian all over again (in a great way)
item.description: The trailer for the film adaptation of Andy Weir's 'Project Hail Mary' has been released, drawing comparisons to 'The Martian.' The film stars Ryan Gosling and is directed by Philip Lord and Chris Miller, with a script by Drew Goddard. Like 'The Martian,' 'Project Hail Mary' is based on a sci-fi novel by Weir and promises a blend of humor and heroism in a space epic. The trailer suggests a similar tone and feel to the successful adaptation of 'The Martian,' raising expectations for another engaging and well-crafted science fiction film.

The government has stated that the workers have been "badly let down" by the situation. The future of the refinery and the impact on the local economy are now major concerns, prompting demands for a thorough investigation into the circumstances leading to the job losses and potential solutions to mitigate the negative consequences.

item.title: After platinum’s stunning 28% June surge, this chart hints at what could happen next
item.description: Platinum experienced a remarkable 28% surge in June, driven by a global supply shortage that began in 2023. While U.S. stocks have reached record highs, platinum's performance stands out. Analysts are now examining market trends to predict the metal's future trajectory, considering factors such as industrial demand and geopolitical influences on supply chains. The sustained shortage suggests potential for continued price volatility and further gains, though market corrections are always a possibility. Investors are advised to monitor supply chain developments and economic indicators closely.

item.title: Can Taiwan help Germany ease its reliance on Chinese drones?
item.description: Germany is exploring Taiwan as a potential drone supplier to reduce its dependence on China. However, significant financial and political obstacles complicate direct procurement from Taipei. The move reflects a broader effort to diversify supply chains and mitigate geopolitical risks associated with relying on a single source for critical technology. Overcoming these hurdles would require navigating complex international relations and potentially addressing budgetary constraints within Germany's defense sector. The outcome could significantly impact Germany's defense capabilities and its strategic alignment in the Indo-Pacific region.

item.title: Black Sabbath’s Early Demos Will Be Released as ‘The Legendary Lost Tapes’
item.description: Black Sabbath fans, rejoice! A collection of early demos, titled 'The Legendary Lost Tapes,' is set to be released. These recordings date back to 1969, before the band adopted the name Black Sabbath, when they were still known as Earth. The collection offers a rare glimpse into the formative stages of the iconic metal band, showcasing their raw sound and early songwriting. Details regarding the release date and tracklist are expected to be announced soon, promising a treasure trove for die-hard Sabbath enthusiasts.

item.title: Solar stocks’ losses are nuclear’s gain, as Elon Musk takes swipe at budget bill
item.description: The Senate's recent tax-and-spending bill is creating winners and losers in the energy sector. While nuclear power stocks are seeing a boost, shares of solar companies are declining. This shift comes as the bill includes provisions that favor nuclear energy development. Elon Musk also weighed in, criticizing aspects of the bill which he believes disadvantages solar energy compared to nuclear. This has further impacted investor sentiment, contributing to the downturn in solar stocks.

item.title: Home Depot is buying GMS for about $4.3 billion as retailer chases more home pros
item.description: Home Depot has announced its acquisition of GMS, a distributor of specialty building materials, for approximately $4.3 billion. This strategic move aims to bolster Home Depot's appeal to professional contractors and home improvement specialists. By integrating GMS's distribution network and product offerings, Home Depot seeks to capture a larger share of the professional market, capitalizing on the demand for specialized building materials and services. The acquisition underscores Home Depot's commitment to expanding its reach beyond the DIY consumer base and establishing a stronger foothold in the professional construction sector.
